dct_description_sm: Issued, June 1888, F.M. Thorn, Superintendent. Verified : B.A. Colonna, Assistant in charge of Office ; Triangulation by C. Rockwell, Assistant ; Topography by J.J. Gilbert, Assistant ; Hydrography by Lieut. Comdr. A.S. Snow U.S.N., and J.J. Gilbert ; Astronomical observations by W.Eimbeck and G. Davidson, Assistants ; Verification of Hydrography by Lieut. Comdr. W.H. Brownson, U.S.N. Inspector of Hydrography ; reduced drawing of Topography by A. Lindenkohl ... hydrography by A. and H. Lindenkohl ; Outlines Title and Notes by H.M. Knight, Topography by W.A. Thompson and R.F. Bartle, Hydrography by H.M. Knight and A. Petersen, Sand by H.M. Knight and H.C. Evans.
Depths shown by soundings and gradient shading (in low water areas); relief by contours and spot heights
Bar scales in statute miles, nautical miles, kilometers
Tides note, buoy legend, notes on elevations and soundings, latitude and longitude of Kalama Astronomical Station
Shows drainage, vegetation, low water areas, islands, railroads, buildings, topography, divisions of land
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Map Collections courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact Branner Earth Sciences Library & Map Collections at brannerlibrary@stanford.edu.
